page.title: 071O COMMANDMENTS (cont'd)
page.content: 5. Remember that it is thy child's{ {privilege}to make a hero out of thee and take thine thought to be a proper one. 6. Remember also that thy{example}is more eloquent than thy faultfinding and moralising. 7. Thou shalt strive to be{a signpost on the highway of life rather than rut in which the wheel cannot turn. 8. Thou shalt teach thy child to stand on his own feet, fight his own battles. 9. Thou shalt help thy child to see {beauty}and{practice kindness}to love truth, and to live in{friendship.} 1O. Thou shalt make the place where in thou dwellest a real home{a haven of {happiness}for thyself and they child, for thy friend and for{thy children's {friend.}
